item.title: Building Batch Pipelines on Google Cloud Platform
item.description: Introduction to Building Batch Data Pipelines Batch Pipelines Overview Definition: Pipelines that process a fixed amount of data and terminate. Example: Daily processing of financial transactions to balance books and store reconciled data. ETL vs ELT: ELT (Extract, Load, Transform): Load raw data into a target system and perform transformations on the fly as needed. Suitable when transformations depend on user needs or view requirements (e.g., raw data accessible through views).
